content: treble_crochet double_crochet treble_crochet 4dc x 3 25 sts per side 10 the three sets of three coloured dcs from round 12 are the bases of the boxes which are separated by four groups of 4dc that s the last of the coloured rounds the final two rounds are worked in black round 15 4dc treble_crochet 3dc treble_crochet 2dc treble_crochet twice 3dc treble_crochet 4dc 27 sts per side you ll be working trebles either side of the coloured boxes made in the last round other than that the rest of the stitches are double crochet the trebles in this round sit directly on top of the black trebles worked in round 13 round 16 this is a tidying up round to help the square lie flat and to make joining the squares easier to do all stitches are worked through both loops of the stitch below the corners remain the same 11 miss 1 stitch 28dc 30 sts per side darn in the eight tails of yarn and block your square if you wish i blocked mine but i m not sure it was really necessary the finished squares should measure about 15 cm / 6 ² i rather like the look of the wrong side too same colours different squares having used the three shades in the order they appear on the colour card - c1 c2 then c3 you can work two more squares following the same order but starting first with c2 and then c3 then if you reverse the order - c3 c2 then c1 - and again start with each shade in turn you get three more variations 12 i expect you can guess what i m going to say next yes you need to work all six variations of the square in each of the seven sets of three colours giving you 42 squares all slightly different here are half the squares worked in the three variations of c1 c2 then c3 i crocheted those first before realising that i could reverse the colour order too i needed a bit more room to lay out all 42 squares … 13 arranging the squares i spent quite a while playing with different patterns before ending up with this one where the shades flow in diagonal lines if you d like to use the same arrangement as me i ve included a plan below if you re not sure about different arrangements of your squares i suggest taking photos of them somehow looking at photos on a screen or printed out makes it easier to choose violet indigo blue green yellow orange red c1 c2 c3 c1 c2 c3 c3 c2 c1 c1 c3 c2 c2 c3 c1 c3 c2 c1 c1 c3 c2 red violet indigo blue green yellow orange c1 c2 c3 c2 c3 c1 c2 c3 c1 c2 c1 c3 c1 c2 c3 c3 c1 c2 c2 c1 c3 orange red violet indigo blue green yellow c1 c3 c2 c2 c3 c1 c3 c1
